SmartSockets Java API
6.8
 PREV CLASS   NEXT CLASS FRAMES    NO FRAMES    
SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.smartsockets
Class Tut

java.lang.Object
  com.smartsockets.Tut
public final class Tut
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of static utility methods.

All handling of settable global options is done here and in the TipcOption class. Options may also be set on a per connection basis through the TipcConnClient interface.

Options are loaded using the Java Properties mechanism, which requires text files containing key/value pairs. These files can either be loaded from the local filesystem, or remotely via a URL.

The keys in a Java property file are, by convention, stated in a heirarchy using dots as a separator. All SmartSockets options are in the "ss" heirarchy, so all of them start with "ss.". An example of an options file would be: 

   ss.project: sat1
   ss.server_auto_connect: false
   ss.unique_subject: node1
Option names and values are case-sensitive. There are methods in this class to extract values as strings, integers, doubles, booleans, and enumerated values. For enumerations, there are methods to set the list of valid values, and their corresponding int values.

See Also:
TipcOption

expect

public static void expect(boolean test,
                          java.lang.String m)
Test a condition for truth, prints a warning message if the it fails. Will optionally throw a TipcAssertionException as well if the expectAborts flag is set.

Parameters:
test - the boolean to check
m - an explanatory message to print with the warning. This is mandatory, since there is no other way of determining where or why the warning occurred.
Throws:
TipcAssertionException - if a previous call to Tut#setExpectAborts was called with a parameter of true (note: TipcAssertionException is a runtime exception)

sleep

public static void sleep(double t)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Sleeps for a period of time.

This is a replacement for Thread.sleep(), which avoids a known problem with priorities and network connections, that makes Thread.sleep() hang a process forever. This method also follows the SmartSockets convention of using a double time in seconds, rather than a long in milliseconds.

Parameters:
t - time to sleep (in seconds).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if another thread interrupts us.

getCurrentTime

public static double getCurrentTime()
Gets the current SmartSockets data time. This time value only changes when the setCurrentTime(double) method is called. It may be used as a marker or unchanging reference.

Returns:
the time as was set on the last call to setCurrentTime(double).

loadOptionsFile

public static void loadOptionsFile(java.lang.String pathname)
Loads an options file from the local filesystem. This method should only be used by applications, or applets running in an unrestricted environment.

If only a filename is given, it will be loaded from the current directory. Full pathnames should always use a "/" character as a directory separator (like UNIX), since Java will automatically convert these as required to the native format.

Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: If the file cannot be found or read, a warning is issued to the "Standard" output.

Parameters:
pathname - the pathname of the options file to be loaded
See Also:
loadOptionsURL(java.lang.String), loadOptionsStream(java.io.InputStream)

loadOptionsURL

public static void loadOptionsURL(java.lang.String pathname)
Loads an options file remotely from a URL. This method may be used by applications or applets. Applets running in a restricted environment should only use this method to load options. Such applets are generally only allowed to access the URL they were downloaded from. Use the java.applet method getDocumentBase to retrieve this URL.

Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: If the file cannot be found or the URL is invalid, or a network connection cannot be made, a warning is issued to the "Standard" output.

Parameters:
pathname - the url of the options file to be loaded
See Also:
loadOptionsFile(java.lang.String), loadOptionsStream(java.io.InputStream)

loadOptionsStream

public static void loadOptionsStream(java.io.InputStream is)
Loads options from an InputStream.

Loaded options override existing options with the same key.

Note: If the stream cannot be loaded, a warning is issued to the "Standard" output.

Parameters:
is - the stream to load the options from.
See Also:
loadOptionsFile(java.lang.String), loadOptionsURL(java.lang.String)

                                   int off,

len - length of the resulting data block in bytes (not the number of chars!)

getNode

Return the local host name.

convertUcs2ToUtf8

public static byte[] convertUcs2ToUtf8(java.lang.String s)
Converts a Java Unicode string to a null-terminated, UTF-8 encoded, array of bytes. Note that this encoding is not the same as the default Java writeUTF and readUTF encoding, which is a length, data encoding. Our encoding is fully compatible with standard C ASCII strings so long as only ASCII is used. The default Java encoding is not only incompatible with this, but requires knowledge of the endian to swap the two-byte length.

Parameters:
s - the Java Unicode string to convert.
Returns:
the UTF-8 encoded byte array.

convertUcs2ToUtf8Ex

public static TipcUtf8Buffer convertUcs2ToUtf8Ex(java.lang.String s)
Converts a Java Unicode string to a null-terminated, UTF-8 encoded, array of bytes. Note that this encoding is not the same as the default Java writeUTF and readUTF encoding, which is a length, data encoding. Our encoding is fully compatible with standard C ASCII strings so long as only ASCII is used. The default Java encoding is not only incompatible with this, but requires knowledge of the endian to swap the two-byte length. This method returns an instance of a TipcUtf8Buffer class which increases the performance. Instead of copying a the buffer, an instance of the TipcUtf8Buffer class is returned, which contains the buffer and the offset and length of the UTF8 data.

Parameters:
s - the Java Unicode string to convert.
Returns:
the UTF-8 encoded byte array.

getProperties

public static TipcProperties getProperties()
Returns the option values shared by all connections as TipcProperties.

Returns:
the global options shared by all connections as TipcProperties.
Since:
SmartSockets 6.0
